targets.expr:
max by(instance, pool) (
  max_over_time(zfs_dataset_creation_timestamp{instance=~"$instance", pool=~"$pool"}[$__range])
  or
  # zfs_dataset_creation was used before official support for creation was added
  max_over_time(zfs_dataset_creation{instance=~"$instance", pool=~"$pool"}[$__range])
) * 1000

group by(instance, version) (label_replace(last_over_time(zfs_exporter_build_info{instance=~"$instance"}[$__interval]), "version", "<missing>", "version", ""))
or on()
(
  vector(0) unless on() last_over_time(zfs_exporter_build_info{instance=~"$instance"}[$__interval])
)

max by(instance, zpool) (
(max_over_time(node_zfs_zpool_state{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", state="online"}[$__interval]) == 1) * 2
or
(max_over_time(node_zfs_zpool_state{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", state="offline"}[$__interval]) == 1) * 3
or
(max_over_time(node_zfs_zpool_state{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", state="removed"}[$__interval]) == 1) * 4
or
(max_over_time(node_zfs_zpool_state{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", state="degraded"}[$__interval]) == 1) * 5
or
(max_over_time(node_zfs_zpool_state{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", state="faulted"}[$__interval]) == 1) * 6
or
(max_over_time(node_zfs_zpool_state{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", state="suspended"}[$__interval]) == 1) * 7
or
(max_over_time(node_zfs_zpool_state{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", state="unavail"}[$__interval]) == 1) * 8
)

# max_over_time to get the newest creation date in case pool with the same name was recreated
# using name=~"$pool" selects root dataset of apool, which is always the oldest dataset
$__to / 1000 - min by(instance, pool) (
  max_over_time(zfs_dataset_creation_timestamp{instance=~"$instance", pool=~"$pool", name=~"$pool"}[$__interval])
  or
  # zfs_dataset_creation was used before official support for creation was added
  max_over_time(zfs_dataset_creation{instance=~"$instance", pool=~"$pool", name=~"$pool"}[$__interval])
)

options.content:
zfs_exporter for vdevs doesn't have info about l2arc devices,
so vdev read/write speed includes only main disks.

targets.expr: sum by(instance, zpool) (rate(zfs_vdev_bytes{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", type="read", vdev="root"}[$__rate_interval]))
sum by(instance, zpool) (rate(zfs_vdev_bytes{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", type="write", vdev="root"}[$__rate_interval]))

panels.description: empty when scrub is not running; draid is not supported

targets.expr:
sum by(instance, zpool) (
  # single-device coefficient: 1
  rate(zfs_vdev_bytes{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", type="read", path!="", vdev=~"disk-.*"}[$__rate_interval])
  or
  # mirror coefficient: 1/count
  (
    rate(zfs_vdev_bytes{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", type="read", path="", vdev=~"mirror-.*"}[$__rate_interval])
    / on(instance, zpool, vdev) group_left()
    avg by(instance, zpool, vdev) (avg_over_time(zfs_vdev_children{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", vdev=~"mirror-.*"}[$__rate_interval]))
  )
  or
  # raid-z coefficient: (count-1)/count
  (
    rate(zfs_vdev_bytes{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", type="read", path="", vdev=~"raidz-.*"}[$__rate_interval])
    * on(instance, zpool, vdev) group_left()
    avg by(instance, zpool, vdev) (1 - 1 / avg_over_time(zfs_vdev_children{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", vdev=~"raidz-.*"}[$__rate_interval]))
  )
  or
  # raid-z2 coefficient: (count-2)/count
  (
    rate(zfs_vdev_bytes{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", type="read", path="", vdev=~"raidz2-.*"}[$__rate_interval])
    * on(instance, zpool, vdev) group_left()
    avg by(instance, zpool, vdev) (1 - 2 / avg_over_time(zfs_vdev_children{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", vdev=~"raidz2-.*"}[$__rate_interval]))
  )
  or
  # raid-z3 coefficient: (count-3)/count
  (
    rate(zfs_vdev_bytes{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", type="read", path="", vdev=~"raidz2-.*"}[$__rate_interval])
    * on(instance, zpool, vdev) group_left()
    avg by(instance, zpool, vdev) (1 - 3 / avg_over_time(zfs_vdev_children{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", vdev=~"raidz2-.*"}[$__rate_interval]))
  )
)
-
sum by (instance, zpool) (rate(zfs_pool_scan_issued_bytes{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__rate_interval]))
and
(
  min by(instance, zpool) (min_over_time(zfs_pool_scan_func{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__interval])) == 1
  and
  min by(instance, zpool) (min_over_time(zfs_pool_scan_state{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__interval]))
)

panels.title: scrub: approx read rate (vdev) divided by parity coefficient, without scrub

targets.expr:
sum by(instance, zpool) (
  # single-device coefficient: 1
  rate(zfs_vdev_bytes{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", type="write", path!="", vdev=~"disk-.*"}[$__rate_interval])
  or
  # mirror coefficient: 1/count
  (
    rate(zfs_vdev_bytes{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", type="write", path="", vdev=~"mirror-.*"}[$__rate_interval])
    / on(instance, zpool, vdev) group_left()
    avg by(instance, zpool, vdev) (avg_over_time(zfs_vdev_children{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", vdev=~"mirror-.*"}[$__rate_interval]))
  )
  or
  # raid-z coefficient: (count-1)/count
  (
    rate(zfs_vdev_bytes{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", type="write", path="", vdev=~"raidz-.*"}[$__rate_interval])
    * on(instance, zpool, vdev) group_left()
    avg by(instance, zpool, vdev) (1 - 1 / avg_over_time(zfs_vdev_children{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", vdev=~"raidz-.*"}[$__rate_interval]))
  )
  or
  # raid-z2 coefficient: (count-2)/count
  (
    rate(zfs_vdev_bytes{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", type="write", path="", vdev=~"raidz2-.*"}[$__rate_interval])
    * on(instance, zpool, vdev) group_left()
    avg by(instance, zpool, vdev) (1 - 2 / avg_over_time(zfs_vdev_children{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", vdev=~"raidz2-.*"}[$__rate_interval]))
  )
  or
  # raid-z3 coefficient: (count-3)/count
  (
    rate(zfs_vdev_bytes{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", type="write", path="", vdev=~"raidz2-.*"}[$__rate_interval])
    * on(instance, zpool, vdev) group_left()
    avg by(instance, zpool, vdev) (1 - 3 / avg_over_time(zfs_vdev_children{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", vdev=~"raidz2-.*"}[$__rate_interval]))
  )
)

panels.title: approx write rate (vdev) divided by parity coefficient

panels.description: empty when resilver is not running; draid is not supported

targets.expr:
sum by(instance, zpool) (
  rate(zfs_vdev_bytes{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", type="read", vdev="root"}[$__rate_interval])
)
-
sum by (instance, zpool) (rate(zfs_pool_scan_issued_bytes{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__rate_interval]))
and
(
  min by(instance, zpool) (min_over_time(zfs_pool_scan_func{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__interval])) == 2
  and
  min by(instance, zpool) (min_over_time(zfs_pool_scan_state{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__interval])) == 1
)

panels.title: resilver: approx read rate (vdev), without resilver

panels.description: empty when resilver is not running; draid is not supported

targets.expr:
sum by(instance, zpool) (
  rate(zfs_vdev_bytes{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", type="write", vdev="root"}[$__rate_interval])
)
-
sum by (instance, zpool) (rate(zfs_pool_scan_issued_bytes{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__rate_interval]))
and
(
  min by(instance, zpool) (min_over_time(zfs_pool_scan_func{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__interval])) == 2
  and
  min by(instance, zpool) (min_over_time(zfs_pool_scan_state{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__interval])) == 1
)

panels.title: resilver: approx write rate (vdev), without resilver

targets.expr: sum by(instance, zpool) (rate(zfs_vdev_ops{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", type="read", vdev="root"}[$__rate_interval]))
sum by(instance, zpool) (rate(zfs_vdev_ops{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", type="write", vdev="root"}[$__rate_interval]))

panels.description: TRIM is performed per-vdev. This graph is an aggregation that show "the worst" TRIM state across all disks in a pool.

targets.expr:
min by(instance, zpool) (
  min_over_time(zfs_vdev_trim_state{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", path!=""}[$__interval])
  and
  (min_over_time(zfs_vdev_trim_unsupported{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", path!=""}[$__interval]) == 0)
)
+
# distinguish if not all devices have the same trim state
(
  ((stdvar by(instance, zpool) (
    (min_over_time(zfs_vdev_trim_state{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", path!=""}[$__interval]))
    and
    (min_over_time(zfs_vdev_trim_unsupported{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", path!=""}[$__interval]) == 0)
  ) == bool 0) * 10)
)
or
min by(instance, zpool) ((min_over_time(zfs_vdev_trim_unsupported{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", path!=""}[$__interval]) == bool 1) + 100)

panels.title: trim state

targets.expr:
sum by(instance, zpool) (
rate(zfs_vdev_trim_processed_bytes{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", path!=""}[$__rate_interval])
and
(min_over_time(zfs_vdev_trim_unsupported{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", path!=""}[$__interval]) == 0)
)

min by (instance, zpool) (
  (
    max_over_time(zfs_vdev_trim_processed_bytes{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__interval])
    /
    (max_over_time(zfs_vdev_trim_estimated_bytes{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__interval]) != 0)
  )
  and
  (min_over_time(zfs_vdev_trim_state{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", path!=""}[$__rate_interval]) < 4)
)

panels.description: Empty, unless trim ran in time range

targets.expr:
# "calc" is a very rough approximation, it is only correct when you zoom in
# "record" value is always correct
max by(instance, zpool) (
  (time() - (max_over_time(zfs_vdev_trim_action_time{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__interval]) != 0))
  *
  (1 / (
    (avg_over_time(zfs_vdev_trim_processed_bytes{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__interval]) != 0)
    /
    (avg_over_time(zfs_vdev_trim_estimated_bytes{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__interval]) != 0)
  ) - 1)
  and
  (min_over_time(zfs_vdev_trim_state{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", path!=""}[$__rate_interval]) < 4)
)

panels.title: trim: estimated remaining time

panels.description: size of the relevant data in the pool when scan was started
panels.title: trim estimated size

options.content:
Scan info is empty for pools
that have never run
scrub or resilver
in their lifetime.

`examined` is about
gathering metadata for scan.

`issued` is actually
reading/writing data.

targets.expr:
# scan is finished or cancelled, show as is
min by(instance, zpool) (min_over_time(zfs_pool_scan_state{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__interval]) > 1)
or
# scan is running but paused
(group by(instance, zpool) (max_over_time(zfs_pool_scan_scrub_pause{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__interval]) != 0) + 20)
or
# scan is running: show function (scrub/resilver)
(
  (
    10
    +
    # when scan starts, zfs_pool_scan_func can change, and ideally we would like to get value AFTER it starts
    # but there is no way to do it
    # - min(min_over_time) prefers scrub
    # - max(max_over_time) prefers resilver
    # and they will prefer it regardless of which one would be correct
    max by(instance, zpool) (max_over_time(zfs_pool_scan_func{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__interval]))
    +
    # distinguish examine and issue stages
    max by(instance, zpool) (max_over_time(zfs_pool_scan_pass_examined_bytes{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__interval]) != bool 0) * 5
  )
  and
  min by(instance, zpool) (min_over_time(zfs_pool_scan_state{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__interval])) == 1
)
or
# pool was never scanned
min by(instance, zpool) ((min_over_time(zfs_pool_scan_state{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__interval]) == 0) + 30)
or
# catch all unexpected values
min by(instance, zpool) (min_over_time(zfs_pool_scan_state{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__interval]) + 40)

max by(instance, zpool) (
  (
    max_over_time(zfs_pool_scan_end_time_seconds{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__interval])
    > on(instance, zpool) group_left()
    max by(instance, zpool) (max_over_time(zfs_pool_load_time_seconds{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__interval]))
  )
  -
  max_over_time(zfs_pool_scan_start_time_seconds{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__interval])
) >= 0
or
max by(instance, zpool) (
  max by(instance, zpool) (max_over_time(zfs_pool_scan_pass_start_seconds{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__interval]))
  -
  max by(instance, zpool) (
    # zfs_pool_load_time_seconds has different labels, so this max works as union
    max_over_time(zfs_pool_load_time_seconds{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__interval])
    or
    max_over_time(zfs_pool_scan_start_time_seconds{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__interval])
  )
)

panels.description: size of the relevant data in the pool when scan was started
panels.title: scan: estimated size

panels.description: can be used to detect scan examine stage ending, also shows a brief scan when pool is imported
panels.title: scan pass start time (ago)

panels.description: empty if examine stage of scan was not running

targets.expr:
max by(instance, zpool) (
  avg_over_time(zfs_pool_scan_examine_estimated_remaining_seconds{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__interval]) != Inf
  and
  (max_over_time(zfs_pool_scan_pass_examined_bytes{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__rate_interval]) != 0)
)

# "calc" is a very rough approximation, it is only correct when you zoom in
# "record" value is always correct
min by(instance, zpool) (min_over_time(zfs_pool_scan_state{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__interval]) == 1)
*
avg by(instance, zpool) (time() - (max_over_time(zfs_pool_scan_start_time_seconds{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__interval]) != 0))
*
  (1 / avg by (instance, zpool) (
    (
      (avg_over_time(zfs_pool_scan_examined_bytes{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__interval]) != 0)
      /
      (avg_over_time(zfs_pool_scan_to_examine_bytes{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__interval]) != 0)
    )
    and
    (max_over_time(zfs_pool_scan_pass_examined_bytes{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__rate_interval]) != 0)
  )
  - 1
)

panels.title: scan: examined: estimated remaining time

panels.description: empty if examine stage of scan was not running

targets.expr:
avg by (instance, zpool) (
  (
    min_over_time(zfs_pool_scan_examined_bytes{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__interval])
    /
    (avg_over_time(zfs_pool_scan_to_examine_bytes{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__interval]) != 0)
  )
  and
  (max_over_time(zfs_pool_scan_pass_examined_bytes{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__rate_interval]) != 0)
)

panels.title: scan: examine completed %

panels.description: Empty, unless scan ran in time range

targets.expr:
# "calc" is a very rough approximation, it is only correct when you zoom in
# "record" value is always correct
min by(instance, zpool) (min_over_time(zfs_pool_scan_state{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__interval]) == 1)
*
avg by(instance, zpool) (time() - (max_over_time(zfs_pool_scan_start_time_seconds{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__interval]) != 0))
*
(1 / avg by (instance, zpool) (
  (avg_over_time(zfs_pool_scan_issued_bytes{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__interval]) != 0)
  /
  (avg_over_time(zfs_pool_scan_to_examine_bytes{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__interval]) != 0)
) - 1)

panels.title: scan: issued: estimated remaining time

targets.expr:
avg by (instance, zpool) (
  min_over_time(zfs_pool_scan_issued_bytes{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__interval])
  /
  (avg_over_time(zfs_pool_scan_to_examine_bytes{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__interval]) != 0)
)
and
min by(instance, zpool) (min_over_time(zfs_pool_scan_state{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__rate_interval]) == 1)
